page.title: 14Home Life
page.content: {Food}Storth has the only small foodstore in the area. Weekly visits by five vans to the eastern side of the area provide fish, groceries, meat, bread, fruit and vegetables. There is a daily delivery of milk. On the western side there are no shops or vans. Residents must resort to neighbouring villages for provisions. {Social Services}Doctors surgeries and health visitors are based at Arnside and Milnthorpe. A further health visitor, based at Crosthwaite, services the farms and houses on the west side. Sandside and Storth have a twice weekly Meals-on-Wheels service. {Services}The villages have mains electricity, gas and drainage. Refuse is collected weekly. A mobile library visits fortnightly. There is one public telephone box in Storth.
